text: Libs waffle on about how good they are at managing the economy, truth is it’s all a charade based on record low rates, iron ore , population growth & housing. Libs also say they are going to reduce debt (never do) & hypercritically want the young to take debt on. No vision, joke.

The blue stuff on your map is easier to move goods over than the green stuff. Average sea freight time to Dampier from China is 9 days (Sydney is 15, but a lot of our iron ore and coal ships from up north). To the UK it's 29.

India is now the world's 2nd largest producer of crude steel at 114mtpa and will be importing about 40-50mt ironore in 2020. This, along with Vietnam's surge and rising steel output in MENA, will keep #ironore market tight for the rest of the decade. New price highs coming. https:// twitter.com/FIMI_India/sta tus/1179992627506073600 …

Why no raw materials? Because there is no rail to take iron ore from Itakpe to Ajaokuta. Why no railway from Itakpe to Ajaokuta? Because NIOMCO in Itakpe is moribund and not functional thus cannot convert Itakpe iron ore to high grade ore for the furnace in Ajaokuta.

3. Railway: 15m tonnes of iron ore cannot be moved by road, as it will destroy the roads, thus a railway was to be built from Itakpe to Ajaokuta to take iron ore from the beneficiation plan in Itakpe to the Ajaokuta. Rail link not working today

#OnThisDay 1984. Striking miners from four pits in the Gwent Valley, South Wales, seized a transporter bridge at Newport. The miners attempted to block supplies of iron ore and coal to British Steel’s strip mill at Llanwern by blocking the movement of ships.

Shock of the day - iron ore price takes another leg down. (62% down at $91 [-3.2%] from $120 at end July.) Fall not a surprise. Producers holding up well. Also 8 stocks that have lost more than 25% in Aug: Massmart, Aspen, Discovery, Mpact, Grindrod, Truworths, EOH & Steinhoff.

Iron ore walloped again, especially lower grades. MBIOI-58 -15.9% to $87.88 MBIOI-62 -6.7% to $100.56 MBIOI-65-BZ -6.5% to $110.50 The decline for 58% fines was the largest since daily spot pricing began in 2013. All 3 grades sit at multi-month lows. pic.twitter.com/yhPmshK754

It does look like the unsustainable rise in iron ore prices was, well, unsustainable. Vale production is coming back & in a win for economics, rising supply relative to a given level of demand = lower prices How low will it go?
